comments.body: Why is this no longer formatted as code? The previous behavior seemed sensible to me.
I guess it might be because it can now include links? In that case I think we should still have it in some monospace font.

Well, to add links in types (markdown doesn't let you mix code formatting with links), and to be a little closer to what the Rst renderer does. I think I'll defer worrying about font formatting to if/when we are trying to replace the Rst website.

diffHunk: @@ -1,58 +1,58 @@ -# Module Iou_template - - +# Module Iou\_template ## Templates -### Template `Iou` - - -| Field | Type/Description | -| :----------- | :---------------- -| `issuer` | `Party` | -| `owner` | `Party` | -| `currency` | `Text` | -| | only 3-letter symbols are allowed | -| `amount` | `Decimal` | -| | must be positive | -| `regulators` | `[` `Party` `]` | -| | `regulators` may observe any use of the `Iou` | +### Template Iou +| Field | Type/Description | +| :--------- | :---------------- +| issuer | Party | +| owner | Party | +| currency | Text | +| | only 3-letter symbols are allowed | +| amount | Decimal | +| | must be positive | +| regulators | \[Party\] | +| | `regulators` may observe any use of the `Iou` | - #### Choices +Choices: -* `Merge` +* Merge + merges two "compatible" `Iou`s - - | Field | Type/Description | - | :--------- | :---------------- - | `otherCid` | `ContractId` `Iou` | - | | Must have same owner, issuer, and currency. The regulators may differ, and are taken from the original `Iou`. | - -* `Split` + + | Field | Type/Description | + | :------- | :---------------- + | otherCid | ContractId Iou |

comments.body: Did we remove the backticks here on purpose?
Yes, to make it closer to Rst docs and to allow for links in the type.
